intro: Onosma halacsyi, commonly known as the Hungarian thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters and has small, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, often displaying shades of blue or violet. Onosma halacsyi is adapted to rocky and gravelly soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
